page.title: 05Farming south of Holcot
page.content: To the south-west of Holcot village the land is mainly devoted to agriculture. The largest farming unit is based at Moulton Lodge and is worked by {Mr.David Watson,}who has rented it since 1971. The farmhouse at{Moulton Lodge}was built on undulating land in 1749 from stone quarried in an adjacent field. Moulton Lodge Farm covers 115 acres and is worked in conjunction with {North Farm,}145 acres, and the rented {Manor Farm,}230 acres, to form {Bestlands Farms.} The other main centres for farming in the area are at{Tithe Farm,}one kilometre south of Holcot village, and at{Moulton Grange Farm}on the south shore of Pitsford Reservoir. The farming is{mainly arable}with only a few livestock being kept.
